Suggested Donations Adults (18+): $5 Students (with ID): $2 Children (12 & Under): $2 PSLBG Members: Free Active Military & Family (with ID): Free Donate Now Get in Touch 2410 SE Westmoreland Blvd. Port St. Lucie, FL 34952 (772) 337-1959 info@pslbg.org Subscribe to Our Newsletter The Gardens is managed and operated by Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charity organization, that was founded to help support the daily operations of The Gardens. Friends volunteers provide hands-on daily oversight of the facility, including staffing to handle the many visitors year round. Please consider becoming a member of Friends. Friends’ is a 100% volunteer organization. In all cases, donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law. © 2025 Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens. All Rights Reserved. Scroll to top

Admission – Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens Facebook X Youtube Instagram LinkedIn Donate Home About 2025 Election Board of Directors & Committees History Newsletters Gallery Visit Us Our Gardens Interactive Map Admission Policies & FAQs Garden Center & Gift Shop Support Donate Commemorate Celebratory Bricks Arbor Day Become a Member Volunteer Events Education Committee Event Calendar Contact Menu Menu Admission Admission Donations The Friends of The Port St.Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc. receives no funding from any government agency. Your admission donations help us maintain and grow The Gardens. We have a suggested donation of $5.00 per person and appreciate any and all monetary support from our valued guests and visitors. Membership options are also available which provide exclusive membership gatherings, hands-on how-to seminars, discounts to our gift shop and paid events, and more. Hours Pavilion & Garden Hours Tuesday – Saturday | 9 AM-5 PM Sunday | Noon – 5 PM Gift Shop Hours Tuesday – Saturday | 9 AM-4 PM Sunday | Noon-4 PM Garden Center Summer Hours *Until September 15th Tuesday – Saturday | 9 AM-12 PM Closed on Mondays & Major Holidays. ​ ​​​Directions From I-95: Exit 118 (Gatlin Blvd.) to Port St. Lucie Blvd. Go East on Port St. Lucie Blvd. Turn right onto Westmoreland Blvd. Turn right at next traffic light into The Gardens. From US 1: Go West on Port St. Lucie Blvd. to intersection of Westmoreland Blvd. and Veterans Memorial Pkwy. Turn left onto Westmoreland Blvd. Turn right at next traffic light into The Gardens. From Florida Turnpike: Exit 142 from Turnpike. Turn right onto Port St. Lucie Blvd. Turn right onto Westmoreland Blvd. Turn right at next traffic light into The Gardens. Note: Handicap accessible. Our Mission Friends’ mission is to create and maintain a beautiful, serene sanctuary in the center of Port St. Lucie that is environmentally sound and naturally diverse and to provide educational, cultural and recreational opportunities for all who visit. Garden Facts ​Opened March 2010 Size – 21 acres (minus wetlands & mangroves, just over 7.5 acres) Size of Lake – 2 acres Lake depth – 12 feet Size of Pavilion – 4100 sq. ft. & can accommodate up to 375 regular seating and 100 table seating. Amphitheater – Seats 140-160 with additional standing on Pavilion Plaza Sidewalks – 6 feet wide. Length 0.91 miles Park Benches – 13 scattered throughout Picnic tables – 2 within The Gardens Cafe tables on the veranda Parking – 41 paved and 85 stabilized spaces for a total of 126 The Gardens is ADA compliant. We do not have wheelchairs or scooters for rent. You are more than welcome to bring standard wheelchairs or handicap scooters for guests in need of assistance. Hours Pavilion & Garden Tuesday – Saturday | 9:00 AM – 5 PM Sunday | Noon-5 PM Gift Shop Tuesday – Saturday | 10:00 AM – 4 PM Sunday | Noon-4 PM Garden Center Tuesday – Saturday | 10:00 AM – 4 PM Sunday | Noon-4 PM Closed on Mondays & Major Holidays. Suggested Donations Adults (18+): $5 Students (with ID): $2 Children (12 & Under): $2 PSLBG Members: Free Active Military & Family (with ID): Free Donate Now Get in Touch 2410 SE Westmoreland Blvd. Port St. Lucie, FL 34952 (772) 337-1959 info@pslbg.org Subscribe to Our Newsletter The Gardens is managed and operated by Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charity organization, that was founded to help support the daily operations of The Gardens. Friends volunteers provide hands-on daily oversight of the facility, including staffing to handle the many visitors year round. Please consider becoming a member of Friends. Friends’ is a 100% volunteer organization. In all cases, donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law. © 2025 Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens. All Rights Reserved. Scroll to top

Garden Center & Gift Shop – Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens Facebook X Youtube Instagram LinkedIn Donate Home About 2025 Election Board of Directors & Committees History Newsletters Gallery Visit Us Our Gardens Interactive Map Admission Policies & FAQs Garden Center & Gift Shop Support Donate Commemorate Celebratory Bricks Arbor Day Become a Member Volunteer Events Education Committee Event Calendar Contact Menu Menu Garden Center & Gift Shop Garden Center The Garden Center nursery specializes in copper leaf plants, coleus, butterfly plants, shrubs, succulents and many other unusual plants that you just can’t get anywhere. Our propagation volunteers are specialists in propagation and produce quality plants at a great value for our members and the public.  We count over 1000 plants available at any time you may visit. The recent addition of the GL Homes Greenhouse has allowed us to increase our variety of plants and to provide additional plants for placement in our Gardens and the public. The Garden Center is open Tuesday through Saturday from 10:00 am – 4:00 pm and Sunday from 12:00 – to 4:00 pm. During Summer our hours are Tuesday through Saturday from 9:00 am – 12:00 pm until mid September. If our plant sales volunteers are not available, please bring your plants to the Gift Shop to purchase.  We are a 501c3 all volunteer organization and all our revenue goes to the benefit of the Port St Lucie Botanical Gardens. Our team of volunteers are available to assist with your purchases and advise on ‘the right plant for the right place’. We are always looking for volunteers, come join our team, learn and have FUN too. Come by and bring home a piece of our Garden home to yours! Garden Center Plant Sales ​​Plant Sales – Plant sales are held in the Garden Center every Saturday. We always have available an abundance of newly propagated plants at great pricing. We also offer Buy one Get one Free on many plants along with discounted plants from one-dollar up! Every day is a plant sale at the Port St Lucie Botanical Garden Center! Horticulture Partnerships Partners in Horticulture Education ​​With the assistance of the St. Lucie County Master Gardeners and PSLBG volunteers, students and Veterans learn basic Horticulture practices. High School Horticulture Club ​​Learn and Earn Community Service hours! Students can volunteer in the Gardens year round. During the school year Horticulture workshops are offered. Workshops and Garden Time hours count toward students’ volunteer community service hours. Open to all High School students! Add your school logo to our growing Horticulture partnership. Contact Jeffrey Chambers, Volunteer Chair at 772-337-1959 for more information. Veteran Victory Corps ​​A horticulture program for Veterans and their family members! Enjoy comradery, hands-on workshops, and opportunities for providing service to your community! VVC meets on the 4th Saturday of the month from 0900-0930 in the Veteran Victory Corps area near the GL Homes Green House in the Garden Center (weather  permitting,  or check at the Welcome Center in the Pavilion)  Bring your own morning drink. Contact: Judy, American Red Cross – Service to the Armed Forces at judy.nash-wade@redcross.org or PSLBG at 772-337-1959. Gift Shop at The Gardens While exploring our magical gardens don’t miss our Gift Shop located in the Garden’s pavilion. Our gifts will delight all ages from small children to seasoned adults. The kids corner will put a smile on all who enter. We offer toys from yesteryear to some of today’s favorites. Don’t miss the carousel of our children’s books. They are perfect for reading to that special someone. For our adult shoppers we offer everything from Faeries to decorative bird baths, unique planters for your favorite plants, lovely jewelry (reasonably priced), wind chimes, fun kitchen items and so much more. We are constantly adding new items so your shopping experience with us is always new and exciting. If you love a bargain (and who doesn’t) we offer spectacular sales from time to time. The discounts run from 10% to 75% off. As a member, you are always welcome to a 10% discount on most items. So, stop in often. We look forward to seeing you! Hours Pavilion & Garden Tuesday – Saturday | 9:00 AM – 5 PM Sunday | Noon-5 PM Gift Shop Tuesday – Saturday | 10:00 AM – 4 PM Sunday | Noon-4 PM Garden Center Tuesday – Saturday | 10:00 AM – 4 PM Sunday | Noon-4 PM Closed on Mondays & Major Holidays. Friends volunteers provide hands-on daily oversight of the facility, including staffing to handle the many visitors year round. Please consider becoming a member of Friends. History – Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens Facebook X Youtube Instagram LinkedIn Donate Home About 2025 Election Board of Directors & Committees History Newsletters Gallery Visit Us Our Gardens Interactive Map Admission Policies & FAQs Garden Center & Gift Shop Support Donate Commemorate Celebratory Bricks Arbor Day Become a Member Volunteer Events Education Committee Event Calendar Contact Menu Menu History Who We Are The Gardens is managed and operated by The Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charity organization, that was founded to help support the daily operations of The Gardens. Volunteers provide hands-on daily oversight of the facility, including staffing to handle the many visitors year round. Please consider becoming a member of The Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens volunteer organization. ​In all cases, donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law. Early City records show that the land was part of the Pruitt Fish Camp. Then in 1981 the site was approved for residential development (Moonraker Bay PUD). That development program was for a 374 residential unit development. The only construction on the site was the installation of the roads and utility infrastructure. Late in 2002 the tract of land formerly known as the Westmoreland property or the Moonraker Project (anecdotal history with the James Bond movie of the same name) was purchased by the City of Port St. Lucie in joint cooperation with St. Lucie County and with grant funding assistance provided by the Florida Communities Trust Land Conservation Program.  As stated in the original management plan the property was purchased to protect an ecologically diverse mosaic of natural plant communities adjacent to the North Fork of the St. Lucie River through the application of management strategies that integrate the restoration, enhancement, and maintenance of the parks natural biological diversity while providing compatible recreation. In 2005 a plan was conceived to develop a portion of the old Westmoreland property as a botanical garden, utilizing and incorporating the sites natural plant communities as the ecological foundation of the proposed garden.  The idea was presented to the Florida Communities Trust Land Conservation Program, a division of the Florida Department of Community Affairs.  In November of 2005 the City received word that the possibility of creating a botanical garden appeared to be appropriate to the site. Soon afterward a conceptual site plan for a botanical garden was developed and re-submitted to the State for approval.  In June of 2006 the City was informed its formal request to redesign the property in accordance with the conceptual site plan for a botanical garden was appropriate pending modification of the properties approved management plan.  A formal amendment to the management plan was drafted and submitted to the State in December 2006. In early 2007, the amendment to the management plan was approved and the City’s ability to develop a botanical garden on a portion of the old Westmoreland property was authorized.   In 2007 the firm of Lucido & Associates was selected to design the botanical garden in accordance with the approved management plan and keeping in mind the original intention of integrating the restoration, enhancement and maintenance of the parks natural biological diversity.   Construction of The Gardens was commenced on March 4, 2009. The Gardens was constructed utilizing native plant communities as the foundation.  Because almost 7 acres were mangrove wetlands along the river, these had to be preserved.  Approximately 1.7 miles of sidewalks were constructed offering winding trails through The Gardens showcasing a variety of trees, shrubs, and plants. Funding: The Gardens was funded through the Florida Communities Trust Land Conservation Program, a conservation trust fund that was developed with impact fees from builders and developers within the City of Port St. Lucie.  This money can only be used for improving or for the purchase of vacant land. These monies are not ad valorum tax dollars (not from direct personal property or other taxes paid to your local government). The Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens: The Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens held its public grand opening on March 6, 2010. The Gardens sit on +/- 20 acres of property on the west side of Westmoreland Boulevard, just south of Port St. Lucie Blvd., conveniently located within the city. The property was acquired through the joint efforts of the City of Port St. Lucie, St. Lucie County, and the Florida Communities Trust Land Conservation Program. The site boasts a lake with a fountain, convenient  paved  paths, beautiful gardens, a pavilion, a gift shop and an array of spaces both inside and out for weddings, meetings, receptions and a host of other events. There is an abundance of convenient on-site parking. The Gardens’ wetlands and mangroves sit on the banks of the beautiful, pristine North Fork of the St. Lucie River. This site is comprised of Scrub, Scrubby Flatwoods, Bay-Gall and Wet Flatwoods, with a mangrove fringe. The 12.87 acres south of The Gardens’ access road will be maintained as undisturbed Florida wetlands, subject only to the removal of exotics and maintenance of an eventual walking trail. Policies & FAQs – Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens Facebook X Youtube Instagram LinkedIn Donate Home About 2025 Election Board of Directors & Committees History Newsletters Gallery Visit Us Our Gardens Interactive Map Admission Policies & FAQs Garden Center & Gift Shop Support Donate Commemorate Celebratory Bricks Arbor Day Become a Member Volunteer Events Education Committee Event Calendar Contact Menu Menu Policies & FAQs View Our Photography Guidelines Q: Are pets allowed? A: Well-behaved pets on a leash are permitted in The Garden. Pets are encouraged to stay on garden paths and event lawn area. Please pick-up after your pets and keep them away from the plants, flowers and shrubs. Pets are not allowed in the Pavilion. We comply with all ADA requirements and accept service animals as defined by the ADA. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Q: Is there an admission fee? A: The Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens is a donation-based facility. We accept all donations at the front desk. Guests are able to make cash, check, credit or debit donations. Memberships are also available for purchase Q: How long does it take to walk through the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens? A: While everyone’s pace is different, we suggest giving yourself about an hour and a half to journey through the 21 acres, and 18 garden rooms. Q: What kinds of discounts do you offer? A: We offer discounts to Members of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens on Gift Shop and Garden Center purchases and select event registrations. We also offer active military discounts on facility rentals. Q: Is the Port St Lucie Botanical Gardens wheelchair accessible? A: Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens is ADA compliant and wheelchair accessible; however, wheelchairs and scooters are not available for rent. You are more than welcome to bring standard wheelchairs or handicap scooters for guests in need of assistance. Q: Do you allow outside food in the gardens? A: Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens is picnic friendly. We have several picnic tables throughout The Gardens. To ensure the grounds are clean and litter free, we request guests place their garbage in trash receptacles. Q: Do you sell water / snacks? A: Our Gift Shop provides water and snack food items. Q: Can I volunteer at the Port St Lucie Botanical Gardens? A: We offer several volunteer opportunities. For information on volunteering visit our volunteer page, here. Q: What is the appropriate attire to wear to the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens? A: We suggest comfortable shoes and casual attire suitable for a family friendly excursion. Don’t forget your bug spray and sunscreen. Hats are always a good idea! Q: Do you have activities for children? A: We have our Discovery Backpacks and scavenger hunt available. There are also specialty scheduled events throughout the year. Visit our events calendar, here. Q: Do you offer daily tours? A: The Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens can accommodate groups between 8-15 people. Group tours must be scheduled through the Events department. In addition, smaller groups and families are welcome to pick up a garden map and be instructed how to proceed once checked in at the Front Desk. To schedule a tour please email, events@pslbg.org . Located on the banks of the North Fork of the St. Lucie River, the site features a lake with a fountain, paved public paths, beautiful gardens, a pavilion, and more! This beautiful sanctuary has numerous gardens overflowing with plant-life, including a butterfly garden, orchid room, and rose garden. Come and enjoy the peace and tranquility today! Weddings, birthday and more are perfect at The Gardens Learn More » ​ © 2008 - 2023 Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc.  All Rights Reserved 2410 SE Westmoreland Blvd., Port St. Lucie, FL 34952  •  Phone: 772.337.1959 •  Fax: 772.237.5952 General Email: i nfo@pslbg.org •   Events Inquiry: e vents@pslbg.org The Gardens are open to the public Tuesday-Saturday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and Sunday Noon to 5 p.m. ​ In all cases, donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law.  Friends is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. The Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, a beautiful 20-acre tropical sanctuary in the city’s center, offers ever-changing opportunities for exploration, education, and entertainment. It captures the essence of beautiful native Florida close to home. Click the Donate Button below and select a donation amount or fill in your own amount. Thank you for your support! Donate Now Honor a Loved One With a Celebratory Brick ​The Gardens has launched a fundraising program meant to decorate our new Serenity Garden to honor and celebrate local friends, family, and loved ones. ​​The Serenity Garden is a peaceful garden for contemplation. This beautiful site affords an opportunity to commemorate an occasion or loved one through an inscribed celebratory brick. Learn More Gifts of Plants to the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens ​ ​The continued success of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens is made possible by monetary and in-kind donations from generous sponsors and community members. We currently accept gifts of plants, garden structures and other garden-related materials. However, all gifts must be justifiable in terms of the Garden’s mission and policies as determined by the Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens. Donations to Propagation Most plants can be accepted as donations to our state-licensed plant propagation nursery. When donated plants are sold, 100% of the proceeds go toward the Garden’s operating expenses. Plants donated to Propagation may be divided and repotted, used as cuttings to propagate new plants, or sold as is. Plants with identified pests or diseases may not be accepted and will be discarded. Likewise, plants identified as invasive by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or the Florida Exotic Pest Plant Council (FEPPC) may not be accepted and will be discarded. Curatorial & Funding Criteria There is limited space in specific display gardens for new plants and garden structures. There is no general funding allotted for the digging, transportation and re-planting. The Gardens gives priority to plants of known wild origin, recorded and documented provenance and (in the case of cultivated plants) known pedigree. Donors must be willing to incur the expenses related to transportation and relocation. Only those plants and materials that satisfy all of the necessary curatorial criteria and that can be installed at no-cost to the Garden can be considered. If you have a donation that satisfies the aforementioned criteria, please contact Joleen King or Michelle Peterson at 772.337.1959 or info@pslbg.org. Download a copy of our Plant Donation Guidelines Here ​. In all cases, donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law. Friends is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. For more information, please contact the Resource Development Committee at 772.337.1959 or mail to Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens, Inc., 2410 S.E. Westmoreland Blvd., Port St. Lucie, FL 34952 You can also contact us directly through this website on our Contact Us page. Become a Member – Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens Facebook X Youtube Instagram LinkedIn Donate Home About 2025 Election Board of Directors & Committees History Newsletters Gallery Visit Us Our Gardens Interactive Map Admission Policies & FAQs Garden Center & Gift Shop Support Donate Commemorate Celebratory Bricks Arbor Day Become a Member Volunteer Events Education Committee Event Calendar Contact Menu Menu Become a Member There are several levels of membership to the Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens All members of the Friends of the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens enjoy exclusive benefits: Membership Benefits: Yearly admission to the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens 10% off most Gift Shop purchases Garden Center Member Specials Reciprocal Admission and/or Discounts to American Horticultural Society Member Gardens Members Only Events – Annual Holiday Party Members Access or Discounts on Selected Classes, Seminars & Events Opportunity to vote for elected members of the Port Saint Lucie Botanical Garden Board of Directors Student: $15 Individual: $35 Family & Friends: $50 Business/Corporate: $75 American Horticultural Society Reciprocity Program​ ​ The American Horticultural Society’s Reciprocal Admissions Program (RAP) promotes horticulture across America, encouraging people to visit gardens while traveling. This program is a network of gardens with similar objectives, encouraging members to discover, explore, and share in this diverse community, striving to make “America a Nation of Gardeners, a Land of Gardens.”  Since its inception in 1990, this program has grown and evolved to represent a diverse community of more than 270 organizations in 45 states, plus Canada,the Cayman Islands, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. AHS members as well as members of the participating gardens have access to a wide array of botanical gardens, arboreta, and conservatories throughout North America offering special admission privileges and many other benefits. CLICK HERE to visit the American Horticultural Society Website and search for a Reciprocal Garden. How membership supports the botanical garden Becoming a member of the Port Saint Lucie Botanical Garden is an exciting way to support plant conservation! Your membership fees help maintain the garden, provide a sanctuary for endangered species, house native species, and support vital biodiversity projects. Plus, you’ll enjoy free admission, special, and the chance to dive into hands-on conservation and wellness activities.
